citations.narrative:
*** The fruit in the freezer located in the monkey house are covered in thick layers of ice and there are dead insects inside
of the freezer. Excess accumulation of ice inhibits proper cleaning and can decrease the nutritive value of the food. The
presence of insects may result in the food becoming contaminated and feeding of contaminated food can cause illness.
The food in the freezer shall be sorted and contaminated or freezer burned food discarded to prevent feeding food that
has decreased nutritional value or is contaminated.
Correct by March 15, 2024.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
***The hard surfaces in the monkey enclosures are in need of thorough cleaning. The walls, floors, counters, storage
shelves, etc have accumulations of waste material, dust and debris. Structures such as plastic swings/platforms provided
in the enclosures have a build up of waste material. Improper cleaning and sanitization increases the risk of disease
hazard which may result in illness and problems with pest control.
Hard surfaces that the primates come in contact must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks and as often as necessary
to prevent an excessive accumulation of dirt, debris, waste, food waste, excreta, or disease hazard.
Correct by March 15, 2023

***The otter room housing several animals is not thoroughly clean. The flooring of the building has excreta and other
waste material around the enclosures and in the walk area. There are structures (toys, platforms, etc) that have grime or
waste material accumulating on them and do not appear to have been recently cleaned. These areas shall be thoroughly
cleaned and maintained at a frequency that will minimize disease hazards and possible contamination of the animals and
food.
Correct by March 15, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
n

narrative:
3.75(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
*** The fruit in the freezer located in the monkey house are covered in thick layers of ice and there are dead insects inside 
of the freezer. Excess accumulation of ice inhibits proper cleaning and can decrease the nutritive value of the food. The 
presence of insects may result in the food becoming contaminated and feeding of contaminated food can cause illness.  
 
The food in the freezer shall be sorted and contaminated or freezer burned food discarded to prevent feeding food that 
has decreased nutritional value or is contaminated.  
 
Correct by March 15, 2024. 
3.84(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
***The hard surfaces in the monkey enclosures are in need of thorough cleaning. The walls, floors, counters, storage 
shelves, etc have accumulations of waste material, dust and debris. Structures such as plastic swings/platforms provided 
in the enclosures have a build up of waste material. Improper cleaning and sanitization increases the risk of disease 
hazard which may result in illness and problems with pest control.  
 
Hard surfaces that the primates come in contact must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks and as often as necessary 
to prevent an excessive accumulation of dirt, debris, waste, food waste, excreta, or disease hazard.  
 
Correct by March 15, 2023 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
***The otter room housing several animals is not thoroughly clean. The flooring of the building has excreta and other 
waste material around the enclosures and in the walk area. There are structures (toys, platforms, etc) that have grime or 
waste material accumulating on them and do not appear to have been recently cleaned. These areas shall be thoroughly 
cleaned and maintained at a frequency that will minimize disease hazards and possible contamination of the animals and

food.  
 
Correct by March 15, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
